LIVEUpdates: Minnesota Lawmakers Hear Emotional Pleas on Overhauling the PoliceDemocrats proposed ambitious legislation on policing and public safety in the state. In Europe, far-right groups pushed back at anti-racism protests. Here’s the latest.
Calls for Racial Justice Touch Seemingly Every Aspect of American LifeIn just under three weeks, what started as a renewed demand for police reform has become a country’s awakening.
Behind Calls to Abolish Police: Six Years of Reforms That FailedMillions of dollars were spent to alter policing after the death of Michael Brown in Ferguson, Mo., in 2014, with little result.
How Black Lives Matter Reached Every Corner of AmericaGeorge Floyd’s death has sparked more than two weeks of protests in all 50 states. See how the movement spread.

Brazil’s Virus Death Toll Surpasses Britain’s to Become World’s 2nd HighestPresident Jair Bolsonaro’s promotion of unproven remedies, including hydroxychloroquine, was cited as a factor that led to the crisis in Brazil.New York’s deaths hit a record low, while Texas and Florida recently reported their highest daily totals of new infections. Here’s the latest.

Self-Isolating at Home in Russia, With 20 OthersIt is about as unpleasant as it would seem. Along with the virus, “a silent paranoia” spreads.
The Economy Is Reeling. The Tech Giants Spy Opportunity.Many companies are retreating. But Amazon, Apple, Facebook, Google and Microsoft are placing bets to get even bigger.

Biden’s Vice-Presidential Search: Who’s on the List and Where It StandsJoe Biden’s search committee is conducting interviews and seeking documents, and prospects like Val Demings and Keisha Lance Bottoms are getting a closer look.

Trump Speaks at West Point Graduation Amid Tensions With Military LeadersThe president said nothing about his clash with the Pentagon over sending active-duty troops to put down demonstrations protesting the death of George Floyd.
We fact-checked President Trump’s misleading claims about the military during his West Point speech.
